setting.name: global-address
setting.label: Public address
setting.description: This is your public (Internet) address. Set this if your ITSP requires a public address and if you do not wish to use STUN to determine that address. If you enter a public address here, any STUN settings will be ignored.

setting.name: global-port
setting.label: Public port
setting.description: Set this if your ITSP requires a specific port.

setting.name: external-address
setting.label: External address
setting.description: This is the address of the external arm of sipXbridge facing the ITSP. Normally this is an IP address on the internal LAN. If sipxbridge runs in your DMZ or is connected to the Internet then this is the same as your public address.

setting.name: external-port
setting.label: External port
setting.description: The ITSP facing port of sipXbridge that corresponds to the external address on your machine. This is the NATed global port.

setting.name: local-address
setting.description: The sipXecs proxy facing address. The sipXecs proxy will send signaling here.

setting.name: local-port
setting.description: The sipXecs proxy facing port. The sipXecs proxy will send signaling here.

setting.name: stun-server-address
setting.label: STUN server
setting.description: The STUN server address used to determine the public address of sipXbridge. If you enter a static public address above, this field is ignored.

setting.name: sip-keepalive-seconds
setting.label: Signaling keep-alive interval
setting.description: Keep-alive timer for SIP signaling in seconds. sipXbridge will periodically re-register with each ITSP to keep the NAT pinhole open.

setting.name: media-keepalive-seconds
setting.label: Media keep-alive interval
setting.description: Keep-alive timer for media (RTP) in seconds. If no media flows and after the time interval expired, sipXbridge will insert dummy media to keep the NAT pinhole open for the media ports.

setting.name: xml-rpc-port
setting.label: API port
setting.description: Port for external XML/RPC requests. If not specified, the XML RPC server is not started. The XML RPC interface is used by sipXconfig to report status to the user.

setting.name: max-number-of-concurrent-calls
setting.label: Maximum calls
setting.description: The maximum number of concurrent calls allowed via the given bridge and for all configured ITSPs. When the limit is reached, sipXbridge will return "Service Unavailable". If nothing is specified, no limit is placed on the max. number of concurrent calls.

setting.name: music-on-hold-support-enabled
setting.label: Music on hold
setting.description: If checked sipXbridge Music On Hold support (MoH) is enabled. Phones should disable their MoH support if sipXbridge support for MOH is enabled. This feature allows playing MoH for phones that do not support MoH as required by sipXecs only for calls that go through sipXbridge.

setting.name: is-reinvite-supported
setting.label: re-INVITE support
setting.description: If checked, media re-negotiation is supported for all ITSPs that are configured. If set, sipXbridge can re-negotiate the choice of codec when an ongoing call is transferred. This gives greater flexibility but can also result in failed transfers if the re-negotiation fails. This setting applies for all ITSPs that are configured on this instance of sipXbridge.

setting.name: allowed-codec-name
setting.label: Allowed codec
setting.description: The codec for the SDP offer / answer that is allowed. This parameter is ONLY relevant if the ITSPs do NOT support re-INVITE. Otherwise it is ignored. If the re-INVITE-supported flag is set to "false" then SDP offers and answers are filtered to allow only this codec through.

setting.name: route-inbound-calls-to-extension
setting.label: Incoming calls destination
setting.description: Determines where to send inbound calls. If empty, inbound calls are directly routed to the specified number in the inbound request and have to be redirected by aliases or dial plan rules. This setting applies to all ITSPs since it is not reliably possible to detect from which ITSP a call arrives if several ITSPs are configured. For incoming calls the ITSP domain is mapped to the own domain (i.e. if a call arrives with sip:1234@myitsp.com, then sipXbridge will map it to sip:1234@mydomain.com. An alias or user ID 1234 needs to exist or an alternative value can be specified in this field.)

setting.name: log-level
setting.label: Logging level
setting.description: Log configuration. Defaults to INFO level.

setting.name: log-directory
setting.description: Log directory. The log file name is hard coded to "sipxbridge.log".
